dialogues.text: Everybody know each other?

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: (extends hand to Sims) Vince Larkin.

dialogues.speaker: SIMS
dialogues.text: (shakes with Larkin) Special Agent Sims, D.E.A. Good to meetcha, Larkin. Larkin hands Sims a photo of a handsome LATIN MAN, 26.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: This is your man. Francisco Cindino. Son of Eduardo Cindino. * The prime mover of narcotics in the world. 7 EXT. U.S. MARSHAL SERVICES - SURVEILLANCE VAN 17¢

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: : That kid’s a potential fountain of information about the family business. Look at him. Nice college boy, right? Well, we've interrogated him for months and he gave up nothing. This is our last chance before the F.B.1I.: gets him and over my dead body are those assholes getting the glory. tee eenne Larkin, Devers, Malloy, and Sims enter surveillance van.  17D «INT. 6/29/96 - REV. WHITE2 14.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: We're picking Cindino up in Carson City. From then until the plane hits Louisiana you've got two hours to get him to talk. We got you a seat right next to him. And e's known to be somewhat garrulous in the company of thieves. Malloy tapes a small MICRORECORDER to Sims‘ stomach and pulis his shirt over it.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Garrulous? What the fuck is “garrulous?"

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: That would be loquacious. Verbose. Effusive. (Malloy stares, blank) How about "chatty."

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: (to Devers) What's with fuckin’ Dictionary-boy, here?

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Thesaurus-boy, I think, is what you're...

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: Vince... Vince and Malloy share an icy glare. Larkin offers a sheepish grin... Malloy turns to Sims...

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: You got your gun? Sims pulls up his RIGHT pant leg, revealing A HANDGUN in ankle holster.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: We've got rules, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: So do we. Our agents go armed...

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: Alright, let’s get this jurisdictional thing out on the table right now. This is a U.S. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6/29/96 - REV. WHITE2 as. CHIEF DEVERS (cont‘d) erect plane and we are in charge oO. t.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: No one carries on these flights, guys. I got a small arsenal in the belly and a pistol in the cockpit lockbox. Other than that, we keep the plane like a prison. No weapons allowed in the main cabin, period.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: My man is not getting on that plane without his gun.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Then your man is not getting on that plane -- Malloy stares at them... Enraged... Then: And Sims hands

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Okay... Give it to them, Willie -- the gun to Larkin.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: (to Malloy, re: Sims) Has this man been briefed in prison behavioral traits?

dialogues.speaker: SIMS
dialogues.text: What's there to know?

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Ten, twenty years locked up in federal institutions changes a person... Heightens their instincts.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Give me a break.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: Listen to him, Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: (to Sims) Avoid eye contact. In the pen it’s considered an invasion of space... A sign of aggression. It’ll give you away in a second. eee 28 te ee +. es eotenee  6/29/96 - REV. WHITE2 16. 18 19

dialogues.speaker: SIMS
dialogues.text: I‘ll be fine. (looks at the video monitor) Jesus Christ, what is that? THE VIDEO MONITOR - The maximum security convoy makes its way around the C-123K.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: We told you today’s flight would be special. Larkin points and everyone watches the monitor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the following three prisoners step from their vans - w should note the ADDED SECURITY attendant to them... Guns extra restraints, etc. The first of the three disembarks. This is BILLY BEDLAM. Guard FALZON, huge, granite-jawed, frisks Billy.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BEDLAM
dialogues.text: Move me, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see BILLY BEDLAM on a video monitor. Larkin reads from his files.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: That’s William Bedford, a.k.a. Billy Bedlam.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: The mass murderer?

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: The same. Caught his wife in bed with another man. Left her alone then drove four towns over to his wife’s family’s house. Killed her parents, her brothers and sisters. Even her dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, like all the cons, has a HOSPITAL-BRACELET around wrist... The bracelet is marked with a BAR CODE... Anothe GUARD runs an electronic GUN over the bar code... It blip and Billy is allowed to pass -- Billy is led, duck-walking in leg irons, to the C-123K's open hatch. + see ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black convict, DIAMOND DOG, late 30s, disembarks. Shave head; African continent TATTOOED on throat; hands duct-ta over tennis balls, inhibiting grabbing. Guard Falzon frisks Diamond Dog.

dialogues.speaker: FALZON
dialogues.text: Diamond Dog Jones. Whoo-hoo! This is like the scumbag all-star team.

dialogues.speaker: DIAMOND DOG
dialogues.text: You don’t miss your water till your well runs dry, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE VIDEO MONITOR - Diamond Dog smiles, revealing a diamond STAR in his left incisor.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Nathan Jones a.k.a. "Diamond Dog." * Former general of The Black Guerrillas. Blew up a meeting of the National Rifle Association. Said they represented the "basest negativity of the white race." Used to brag that he’s "killed more men than cancer... " (guards frisk Diamond Dog) Wrote a book in prison. "Reflections In A Diamond Eye." THE NEW YORK TIMES called it a “wake-up call for the black community..." (off Malloey’s look) They're talking to Denzel for the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another CON has disembarked - late 30s, shaved head, a * smiler. His name is CYRUS GRISSOM, a.k.a. "Cyrus the Virus."

dialogues.speaker: SIMS
dialogues.text: (getting increasingly * nervous) * Who's this fucking guy? 7

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: His name is Cyrus Grissom, a.k.a. * Cyrus The Virus. *

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: Hello, hooray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: co 6/29/96 - REV. WHITE2 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men watch... Sims is becoming more and more uneasy wi each con...

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: This one’s done it all... Kidnapping, Robbery, Murder, Extortion. Thirty-nine years old, twenty-five of them spent in our institutions. He’s got serious juice inside the system... Owns the vine. Larkin notices Sims’ flop-sweat...

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Inside he’s earned two degrees, killed 11 fellow inmates, incited three riots, and escaped twice. I’d say he’s a true product of the system.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: What do you mean by that? "He’s a product of the system?" What the fuck does that mean? You’re not one of those sociology majors who thinks we're responsible for breeding these assholes?

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: If we're not, then who is?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Ever hear of genetics? How about an extra Y chromosome? They should just fly the fuckin’ plane into the side of a mountain. Do mankind a favor.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Don’t think that hasn’t been discussed.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: Knock it off guys. If you wanna put an agent on my plane, fine. Anything happens, it’s on your ead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poe's minimum security bus pulls into the secured area. P and Baby-O get off. Poe looks at the C-123K. Guard Bishop and the other Guards escort Poe, Baby-0, etc to the frisk point. Guard Falzon pats Poe down. Falzon pulis Poe’s PHOTO OF HIS DAUGHTER from Poe’s pocket. 23 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aoteee ee eeeee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eee ee.  6/29/96 - REV. WHITE2 is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No personal items.

dialogues.speaker: POE
dialogues.text: It’s my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: FALZON
dialogues.text: (pockets the photo) I don’t care if it’s the weeping srt of Christ, you know the rules. Poe gets in Falzon’s face, nose-to-nose. Bishop walks by, checking off numbers on her clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Easy, boys. There’s enough root beer for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MONITOR - POE AND FALZON argue heatedly.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: (re: Poe) Who's that? Larkin flips pages, coming to Poe’s PHOTO.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Cameron Poe. He’s nobody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poe steps on board the plane and we see for the first tim the complex lattice work of bars and wires, mesh and plex Four STEEL SINGLE-MAN CAGES spread throughout. Guard Falzon hits a BUTTON at the FRONT GALLEY. A LIGHT o the cages goes from RED to GREEN. OTHER GUARDS throw levers; the cage doors slide open mechanically. Poe walks to the rear and sits across the aisle from a weasely, snipe-faced MAN, early 30s.

dialogues.speaker: PINBALL
dialogues.text: Pinball Parker. Armed robber. Arsonist. Dope fiend. Hell of a nice guy. 28 j$INT. SURVEILLANCE VAN - DAY The van doors open.

dialogues.speaker: 26A
dialogues.text: 27 28  6/29/96 - REV. WHITE2 20. fee sea pe 29

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: No one knows your classification, Agent Sims, not even my guards. So keep your wheels on the ground...

dialogues.speaker: SIMS
dialogues.text: Let's do it. Sims and Larkin get out of the van. *

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Tell me, Skip: Is the U.S. Marshal Services in the habit of employing annoying wise-ass bookworm creeps?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: Larkin’s one of the best we've got, Dunean --

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I'd still like to crush his larynx with my boot.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DEVERS
dialogues.text: Charming. Malloy sees Sims on the video monitor... Sees him being l to the plane... He hops out of the van... Larkin walks past the C-123K GUARDS as they continue the prep... He slaps some backs, low fives... *

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Good flight, guys. *

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Thanks, Vince. * Larkin passes Bishop. *

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: How's the golf game, Bishop? *

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: They re still making the balls too * small. *

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Good flight, Sally. *

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: See ya, Vince. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE CAGES hold Cyrus The Virus, Diamond Dog, and Billy Bedlam. The fourth cage is empty. Falzon hits the button and the cage-lights GO BACK TO RED.  6/29/96 - REV. WHITE2 21.

dialogues.speaker: 295A
dialogues.text: 293 Falzon, moving down the aisle, finishes his inventory. He absently sticks his pen in his breast pocket. Bishop grab t.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Unh unh. Everything’s a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: FALZON
dialogues.text: Shit. Right. Falzon takes the pen back and clips it to a SPECIAL CHAIN AROUND HIS NECK and slides it under his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sims’ bar-code bracelet is read... Another GUARD moves to frisk him... Malloy appears...

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: I got him -- And Malloy frisks Sims... And when he gets down to Sims’ LEFT ankle, there’s a lump... And Malloy looks up... And winks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinball Parker sits next to a sinewy NATIVE AMERICAN...

dialogues.speaker: PINBALL
dialogues.text: What’s up, Cochise -- ? The Indian merely stares ahead, stone-faced...

dialogues.speaker: PINBALL, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, don’t go gettin’ all Wounded Knee on me and shit... A Guard leads Agent Sims onto the plane. He takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: POE
dialogues.text: looks at Billy Bedlam in his cage... Billy snarls:

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BEDLAM
dialogues.text: You eyeballin’ me, punk -- ?

dialogues.speaker: POE
dialogues.text: I was just admiring your cage. Fits you real good -- Baby-O calls to the medic, CHAMBERS.

dialogues.speaker: BABY-O
dialogues.text: I need my shot.

dialogues.speaker: CHAMBERS
dialogues.text: You'll get it when we're airborne.  Cc 8/19/96 - REV. BLUE3 22.

dialogues.speaker: BABY-O
dialogues.text: (mumbles) These fuckers won’t be happy till I go into a deep, dark tropical coma. Guard Falzon walks the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: FALZON
dialogues.text: Well, well! We got out and out celebrities in here. We got a combined 11 HARD COPY appearances, two CURRENT AFFAIRS. And one genuine GERALDO interviewee. (Diamond Dog bows) But I gotta tellya - I ain’t impressed... So let’s get this straight, gentlemen. We got rules: One, keep your hands in your laps; 2) keep the decibel level down; 3) You spit, you bite, you scream - you will get the "treatment"... As if on cue, A SKINHEAD hocks a looey at Falzon --

dialogues.speaker: SKINHEAD CON
dialogues.text: Fuck you, pig -- Falzon wipes the spit off his face... Smiles... To anothe

dialogues.speaker: FALZON
dialogues.text: Gag and bag this Nazi muffin -- The guards slap duct tape and mesh netting over the skinh con’s face... Falzon moves on down the line... FALZON (CONT’D) These rules will be enforced. If not, I will be gargling testicles. Understood? CYRUS THE VIRUS looks at a Mexican convict seated in fron of his cage: JOHNNY 23, covered in pachuco tattoos. The following is Spanish with sub-titles:

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: Are you a notorious criminal, friend?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY 23
dialogues.text: Fuck, yeah. You don’t know of me? I’m called "Johnny 23."

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: You’re Johnny 23? Of course I know you. You're clubbed-in with the Mex Mafia. Serving seven life sentences for rape. 23 counts of rape... +e eee eee ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: weet  8/19/96 - REV. BLUE3 22a. anti And Johnny 23 shows his RIGHT FORE-ARM for Cyrus’ inspection: for there are 23 HEARTS TATTOOED THERE...

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY 23
dialogues.text: One for each of my 23 ladies... He leers at Guard Bishop as she walks by. JOHNNY 23 (CONT’D) (grins, in English) If they knew the truth, I’d be called "Johnny 600."

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: Doesn’t have quite the same ring... But I despise rapists... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: 32B
dialogues.text: o CYRUS THE VIRUS (cont’d) For me they’re somewhere between cockroaches, and the white stuff that accumulates at the corners of your mouth when you're real thirsty... (suddenly grins) But with you I'11 make an exception. (to Falzon, who walks by, imperious) What‘s the in-flight movie today, Falzon?

dialogues.speaker: FALZON
dialogues.text: It’s a good one, Cyrus. It's called, “I'll Never Make Love To A Woman On The Beach Again." And it‘s preceded by the award-winning short: "No More Steak For Me Ever."

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: Funny fucker, aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch slowly raises. The plane taxis to the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larkin, through a window, watches the plane take off. Gin joins him... She looks very uneasy...

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: I hope this goes smoothly --

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Please, Ginny. This is a well-oiled machine. Only thing to worry about are stale peanuts and a little turbulence. Ginny walks off looking dubious.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: (he looks out the window: nervous now) I hope this goes smoothly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poe and Baby-O settle in for the flight. IN HIS CAGE - CYRUS THE VIRUS has begun to PICK AT A CALL ON HIS LEFT HAND. 30 31

dialogues.speaker: 32B
dialogues.text: * (eee eee een eee eee  6/29/96 - REV. WHITE2 24. 32¢ Falzon walks by. Cyrus stops his callus picking. Falzon moves on to Diamond Dog, getting in his face.

dialogues.speaker: FALZON
dialogues.text: What‘’s the word these days, 0.G.? (Diamond Dog fixes him with that icy glare) Don't tell me: you found Allah in the joint, right?

dialogues.speaker: DIAMOND DOG
dialogues.text: We're all yoked to the same chariot, my friend. DOWN THE AISLE - Bishop walks by Poe.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: How you doing, Poe?

dialogues.speaker: POE
dialogues.text: Fine. You got a first name, Guard Bishop?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: No, it’s just Bishop. Like Prince. Or Cher. You know: Madonna --

dialogues.speaker: POE
dialogues.text: It works for you --

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It's Sally...

dialogues.speaker: POE
dialogues.text: Sally Bishop. Sounds like an astronaut. Or a schoolteacher.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: There's a little of both in this gig, Poe, lemme tell ya. IN HIS CAGE - CYRUS THE VIRUS continues picking at his callus. He stops whenever a Guard walks by. IN HIS CAGE - DIAMOND DOG is also PICKING AT A CALLUS at palm of his hand. CYRUS nods to Pinball. EXT. C-123K - DAY 32¢ The plane lifts-off... We can see the SKYSCRAPERS of a ci in the b.g. The plane ascends...  9/4/96 - REV. GOLDENROD3 25. 33 Cc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinball checks the vicinity for guards... None nearby... sticks his hands in his mouth. Fishes for a PIECE OF DENT FLOSS tied to his back molar. He tugs on the floss, pulli it from his mouth. Six inches, then a foot. Poe watches, puzzled... Johnny 23 has also caught this... The Indian stares straight ahead... Pinball pulls up from his stomach a BLOB OF WAX and eject it into his hand. He breaks it apart... breaking the wax, revealing a pinky-sized SQUIRT TUBE and a wooden blue-tip MATCH. IN HIS CAGE - CYRUS THE VIRUS has completed his callus- picking. There, embedded in the skin beneath his ring finger, is the TIP of a PIN. A few more picks. The HAFT of the pin is out. Cyrus pluck the PIN from his palm. He begins to SHIM his handcuff locks. IN HIS CAGE - DIAMOND DOG has picked his callus open, revealing, likewise, A PIN. He also begins to shim... In moments, both men are free of their cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: PINBALL
dialogues.text: turns to Poe... Makes the "Sssh" gesture... Grins... He turns to the Indian... And SQUIRTS HIS SEAT with LIQUID from the tube... The Indian turns, face impassive... Pinball smiles at him...

dialogues.speaker: PINBALL
dialogues.text: Hi, there -- 33  i 7/12/96 - REV. YELLOW2 26. Ge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABY-O watches as, the medic, CHAMBERS, waiks over, carry a syringe and a kit containing several AMPULES of INSULIN

dialogues.speaker: CHAMBERS
dialogues.text: Okay, left arm. i BABY-O (smiles with relief) : About fucking time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chambers swabs his arm, readying the shot... Finds a vein. .

dialogues.speaker: PINBALL
dialogues.text: strikes the blue-tipped match with his thumb... And tosse it onto the Indian’s seat... FOOM! Chambers looks up, pulling the syringe away, having not given Baby-O his shot -- The Indian is on fire... Pinball screams... The guards ru down here... Pinball gets to his feet... The guards spray the Indian with a fire extinguisher... Pinball screams hysterically through this whole sequence

dialogues.speaker: COMBUSTION SHIT, MAN
dialogues.text: CRAZY! HE’S A WITCH DOCTOR! HE‘S A_ CRAZY WITCH DOCTOR! I AIN‘T SITTIN’ NEXT TO NO CRAZY WITCH DOCTOR - [1tl -- all the while making his way to the CAGE LEVERS... He throws the first one... We see the cage-lock-light go from RED TO GREEN. A KLAXON SOUNDS; the cabin lights shut off; emergency lig on the side of the cabin illuminate. Bishop whirls, slams Pinball against the wall with her nightstick, but it’s too late -- -- Diamond Dog’s cage opens. Diamond Dog charges out, facing CHAMBERS. He BURIES the HASP of one cuff into Chambers’ throat. Chambers SCREAMS and flails. Diamond Dog lifts Chambers bodily; Chamber’s legs whip across the aisle. Chambers’ boot its A GUARD in the face and slams against the wall, hitting the BACK HATCH RELEASE BUTTON. THE BACK HATCH begins to lower. Wind whips through the cabin. Chamber’s INSULIN AMPULES fall, some shattering. Guards converge on Diamond Dog, diving atop him. He bucks like a bronco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diamond Dog and the struggling Guards STOMP the unbroken insulin ampules. Poe is up in his seat, slightly amazed at this turn of events. i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i i 1 26A.  8/22/96 - REV. PINK3 27. Baby-O looks at the crushed ampules in horror.

dialogues.speaker: BABY-O
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off my insulin! Falzon grabs a TASER from the galley and fires several JO into Diamond Dog, who goes down writhing. IN HIS CAGE - CYRUS pounds on the cage door. Pinball, fending off Bishop, lunges for the second lever yanks it. Cyrus’ cage door SLIDES OPEN. A GUARD turns. Cyrus bolts out and cold cocks the guard. Cyrus bolts for the cockpit A single GUARD remains between Cyrus and the cockpit. Cyrus, using the cuffs as brass knucks, hits the guard. The guard drops. THE GUARDS at the rear see the trouble up front. Bishop a Falzon bolt for the front of the plane. But Diamond Dog a Pinball drop into the aisle, blocking their way. Cyrus rips open the cockpit door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just as the Co-Pilot RIPS OPEN the lockbox beneath hi seat and pulls out the only GUN on board... The Co-Pilot FIRES WILDLY at Cyrus, who dives out of the way, as bullets --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- stream the main cabin... TWO CONS are center-punched w smoking holes and go down dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyrus whips his length of waist-chain at the co-pilot, smearing the man’s features with the blunt steel... The co-pilot falls against the instrument panel... The pl jerks... Cyrus retrieves his gun... Aims it at the dazed co-pilot... BLAM! He shoots the co-pilot... 7 Cyrus turns... In time to see the PILOT’S HAND move under the dash, hitting the EMERGENCY BUTTON...

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: Say there was a disturbance but everything's under control. Do it or I will kill you.

dialogues.speaker: 37A
dialogues.text: +e ee

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: The hell you will. Without me there's no one to fly the plane.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: I never think that far ahead. ae Cyrus pulls back the hammer. The Pilot grabs the radio.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Uhh, Carson City....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop continues to struggle with Pinball, Falzon with Diamond Dog. CYRUS exits the cockpit with the gun. He aims down the fuselage and FIRES. The BULLET strikes the BLARING KLAXON. Bishop, Pinball, Falzon, Diamond Dog, etc. freeze. All eyes focus on Cyrus.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: This is your captain speaking. Welcome to Con Air... (points to Falzon) The keys, Falzon. {holds up unlocked cuffs) The keys for these. The cons ROAR with approval... Poe looks at Baby-O... It’ all bad...

dialogues.speaker: POE
dialogues.text: Christ in a cartoon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded room. Consoles and meteorological indicators. Crackling radio communications between tower and planes. Ginny's on the radio. A RED SILENT ALARM IS FLASHING. Larkin enters hurriedly, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: What the hell happened? Ginny's on the radio to Carson City.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Roger that, Carson City. (clicks off radio) Calm down, Vince. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 GINNY (cont’d) Just a little ruckus and the pilot hit the alarm. He just checked in; everything's fine. Transponder is confirmed. (the SILENT ALARM stops flashing) See, there’s your baby -- Ginny points to a BLIP on the RADAR SCREEN, brighter and larger than OTHER AIRCRAFT: Flight 377.

dialogues.speaker: LARKIN
dialogues.text: Her cargo’s ugly. But her constitution is strong. Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back hatch is closed. Cyrus walks up to Bishop...

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS THE VIRUS
dialogues.text: What are the numbers in Carson City? How many on, how many off? What are they -- ?

dialogues.speaker: FALZON
dialogues.text: (studies manifest) Six off, ten on... Cyrus plucks the manifest from Falzon’s hand... Gives it Pinball...
